snippet: A historian of black gospel music has written a book that intends to expose what he calls the hypocrisy of the black church’s opposition to same-sex marriage.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column discusses Anthony Heilbut book The Fan Who Knew Too Much, which pays homage to the artistic role of gays and bisexuals in gospel music and criticizes black Christian, clergy and laity alike of hypocrisy in opposing same-sex marriage; observes that the subject matter and the timing of the book's release has thrust it into the spotlight of the political arena in a presidential election year.
lead_paragraph: A historian of black gospel music has written a book that intends to expose what he calls the hypocrisy of the black church’s opposition to same-sex marriage.
